message.content:
Electronic Arts is a game developer and publisher, and Metroid is a popular video game series developed by Nintendo. The first game in the series was released in 1986, and since then, several sequels have been developed and released. So, the question here is whether or not Electronic Arts profited from any of the Metroid game sales.

To answer this question, we need to know if Electronic Arts was involved in the development or distribution of any Metroid games. However, as per the records, Nintendo has always been the sole developer and publisher of the Metroid series, and Electronic Arts has never been involved in any of its releases. Hence, it is safe to say that Electronic Arts did not profit from any of the Metroid game sales, and the correct answer is B - No.

Firstly, Electronic Arts (EA) is a well-known video game publisher and Metroid is a popular video game series developed and published by Nintendo. 

Secondly, since Metroid is a game developed and published by Nintendo, it is highly unlikely that EA would profit directly from the sales of Metroid games. 

Thirdly, even if EA had some involvement in the development or distribution of a Metroid game, it would depend on the terms of their agreement with Nintendo and the percentage of profits that they would be entitled to. 

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no, as it is unlikely that EA would profit from Metroid sales.

However, there is no information provided that suggests Electronic Arts has any type of partnership with Nintendo regarding Metroid sales. Therefore, it is safe to assume that Electronic Arts did not profit from Metroid sales. 

Thus, the correct answer is (B) no.
